sen.j: 葛野郡（かどののこおり・かどのぐん）は、山城国、京都府にかつて存在した郡である。
sen.e: Kado no Koori (Kadono gun) (Kadono District) is the district where the Yamashiro Province, Kyoto Prefecture existed.
Kado no Koori (Kadono gun) (Kadono District) is the district where Yamashiro Province, Kyoto Prefecture exists.
Kado no Kori (Kadono-gun) was a district that existed in Yamashiro Province, Kyoto Prefecture.
sen.cmt: かつて存在した、 という表現にしました。

sen.j: 古代に隣接する愛宕郡とともに郡域の一部が平安京となり、現在では全域が京都市に含まれている。
sen.e: The part of its district and the area of Otagi District next to it in ancient times became the Heiankyo (the ancient capital of Japan in current Kyoto) and all of its area is currently included within Kyoto City.

Part of its district and the area of Otagi District next to it in ancient times became the Heiankyo (the ancient capital of Japan in current Kyoto) and all of its area is currently included within Kyoto City.

Part of its district and the area of Otagi District next to it in ancient times became the Heian-kyo (the ancient capital of Japan in current Kyoto) and all of its area is currently included within Kyoto City.

sen.j: 1879年（明治12年）4月10日 - 郡区町村編制法に基づき太秦村にを設置。
sen.e: April 10, 1879: From the Gun-ku-cho-son Henseiho (Act for the alignment of local government system), the Kadono District Public Office was built in Uzumasa Village.
April 10, 1879: From the Gun-ku-cho-son Henseiho (Act for the alignment of local government system), the Kadono District Public Office was built in Uzumasa Village.
April 10, 1879: From the Gun-ku-cho-son Henseiho (Act for the alignment of local government system), the Kadono District Public Office was built in Uzumasa Village.

sen.j: 1889年（明治22年）4月1日 - 市制・町村制施行。
sen.e: April 1, 1889: They carried out the act of the City, town, and village.
April 1, 1889: The act of the City, town, and village was carried out.
April 1, 1889: The act of the City, town, and village was carried out.

sen.j: 上京区・下京区が統合されて京都市となり、葛野郡より離脱する。
sen.e: Kamigyo and Shimogyo Wards were combined together to form Kyoto City and separated from Kado no Koori
Kamigyo and Shimogyo Wards were combined together to form Kyoto City and separated from Kado no Koori
Kamigyo and Shimogyo Wards were combined together to form Kyoto City and separated from Kado no Koori

sen.cmt: アラビア数字で統一しました。

sen.j: 1902年（明治35年）2月1日 - 大内村の一部が京都市下京区に編入。
sen.e: February 1, 1902: Part of Oochi Village was placed in Shimogyo Ward, Kyoto City.
February 1, 1902: Part of Oochi Village was placed in Shimogyo Ward, Kyoto City.
February 1, 1902: A part of Ouchi Village was merged into Shimogyo Ward, Kyoto City.

sen.j: 1903年（明治36年）12月1日 - 下嵯峨村が嵯峨村に編入。
sen.e: December 1, 1903: Shimosaga Village became part of Saga Village
December 1, 1903: Shimosaga Village became part of Saga Village
December 1, 1903: Shimosaga Village became part of Saga Village

sen.cmt: アラビア数字で統一しました。

sen.j: 衣笠村が京都市上京区に編入。
sen.e: Kinugasa Village became a part of Kamigyo Ward, Kyoto City.
Kinugasa Village became a part of Kamigyo Ward, Kyoto City.
Kinugasa Village became a part of Kamigyo Ward, Kyoto City.

sen.j: 朱雀野村・大内村・七条村、西院村の一部が京都市下京区に編入。
sen.e: Sujakuno, Oochi, Shichijo, and a part of Saiin Villages became part of Shimogyo Ward, Kyoto City.
Sujakuno, Oochi, Shichijo, and a part of Saiin Villages became part of Shimogyo Ward, Kyoto City.
Sujakuno, Ouchi, Shichijo, and a part of Saiin Villages were merged into Shimogyo Ward, Kyoto City.

sen.j: 1923年（大正12年）4月1日 - 嵯峨村が町制施行し嵯峨町となる。
sen.e: April 1, 1923: Saga Village transformed into a town and became Saga Town
April 1, 1923: Saga Village transformed into a town and became Saga Town
April 1, 1923: Saga Village transformed into a town and became Saga Town

sen.cmt: アラビア数字で統一しました。

sen.j: 1931年（昭和6年）4月1日 - 嵯峨町・花園村・西院村・太秦村・梅ヶ畑村・梅津村・京極村・松尾村・桂村・川岡村が京都市に編入し、右京区が発足。
sen.e: April 1, 1931: Saga Town and villages of Hanazono, Nishiin, Uzumasa, Umegahata, Umezu, Kyogoku, Matsuo, Katsura, and Kawaoka became a part of Kyoto City and Ukyo Ward was born
April 1, 1931: Saga Town and villages of Hanazono, Nishiin, Uzumasa, Umegahata, Umezu, Kyogoku, Matsuo, Katsura, and Kawaoka became a part of Kyoto City and Ukyo Ward was born
April 1, 1931: Saga Town and villages of Hanazono, Saiin, Uzumasa, Umegahata, Umezu, Kyogoku, Matsuo, Katsura, and Kawaoka became a part of Kyoto City and Ukyo Ward was born

sen.j: 1942年（昭和17年）7月1日 - 京都市に愛宕郡・葛野郡・乙訓郡を管轄する北山城地方事務所を設置。
sen.e: July 1, 1942: Kitayama Castle Local District Office was established to have a jurisdiction over Otagi, Kadono, and Otokuni Districts at Kyoto City.
July 1, 1942: Kitayama Castle Local District Office was established to have jurisdiction over Otagi, Kadono, and Otokuni Districts at Kyoto City.
July 1, 1942: Northern Yamashiro Local District Office was established to have jurisdiction over Otagi, Kadono, and Otokuni Districts at Kyoto City.
sen.cmt: 北山城→northern Yamashiroとしました。

sen.j: 1948年（昭和23年）4月1日 - 小野郷村・中川村が京都市上京区に編入。
sen.e: April 1, 1948: Onogo and Nakagawa Villages became a part of Kyoto City.
April 1, 1948: Onogo and Nakagawa Villages became a part of Kyoto City.
April 1, 1948: Onogo and Nakagawa Villages became a part of Kyoto City.
Kadono District was abolished on the same day.
Kadono District was abolished on the same day.
Kadono District was abolished on the same day.

sen.j: 和名抄に見える郡内の郷
sen.e: Go (home village) within the district seen in "Wamyo Ruijusho" (dictionary of Japanese names).
